The following classes can be linked to a tag/asset inside your swf:<br>
<br>
1)flash.display.Bitmap<br>
2)flash.display.BitmapData<br>
3)flash.display.MovieClip<br>
4)flash.display.Sprite<br>
5)flash.display.SimpleButton<br>
6)flash.media.Sound<br>
7)flash.text.Font<br>
8)flash.utils.ByteArray<br>
9)The document class of your script<br>
{{{
<swf>
	<Header/>
	<FileAttributes />
	
	<!--flash.display.Bitmap-->
	<DefineBitsJPEG2 id="1" file="picture.png" />
	<SymbolClass id="1" class="com.example.MyBitmap" base="flash.display.Bitmap"/>
	
	<!--flash.display.BitmapData-->
	<DefineBitsJPEG2 id="2" file="picture.png" />
	<SymbolClass id="2" class="com.example.MyBitmapData" />
	
	<DefineShape id="3" bitmapId="1" />
	
	<!--flash.display.MovieClip-->
	<DefineSprite id="4" frameCount="2">
		<PlaceObject id="3" depth="1" />
		<ShowFrame />
		<PlaceObject id="3" depth="1" move='true'/>
		<ShowFrame />
	</DefineSprite>
	<SymbolClass id="4" class="com.example.MyMovieClip" base="flash.display.MovieClip/>
	
	<!--flash.display.Sprite-->
	<DefineSprite id="5" frameCount="1">
		<PlaceObject id="3" depth="1" />
		<ShowFrame />
	</DefineSprite>
	<SymbolClass id="5" class="com.example.MySprite" base="flash.display.Sprite"/>
	
	<!--flash.display.SimpleButton-->
	<DefineButton id="6">
		<ButtonState up='true' id='3' depth='1' />
		<ButtonState over='true' id='3' depth='1' />
		<ButtonState down='true' id='3' depth='1' />
		<ButtonState hit='true' id='3' depth='1' />
	</DefineButton>
	<SymbolClass id="6" class="com.example.MySimpleButton" base="flash.display.SimpleButton"/>
	
	<!--flash.media.Sound-->
	<DefineSound id="7" file="sound.mp3" />
	<SymbolClass id="7" class="com.example.MySound" base="flash.media.Sound"/>
	
	<!--flash.text.Font-->
	<DefineFont id="8" file="fontInSwf.swf" />
	<SymbolClass id="8" class="com.example.MyFont" base="flash.text.Font"/>
	
	<!--flash.utils.ByteArray-->
	<DefineBinaryData id="9" file="picture.png" />
	<SymbolClass id="9" class="com.example.MyByteArray" base="flash.utils.ByteArray"/>
	
	<!--your document class (must always be id 0) -->
	<DefineABC file="Script.swf" />
	<SymbolClass id="0" class="com.example.MyDocumentClass" />

	<ShowFrame/>
	
</swf>
}}}
If you supply a base class then a class with the according actionscript bytecode will be automatically generated and added to the swf. If you omit a class for the base attribute then you must define one inside your script that extends the correct class.
